author: Ernst
title: Gold Getaway ? I call it : Prisoner Carriage
review:
Overall 4 bricks : A nice additional set to the 2013 Castle theme. Not a real must have set but useful considering the parts content and for the younger Lego fan loads of playability. The price is ok considering the content with 3 mini figures and a horse. Overall a very acceptable set for a reasonable price.

Building 4 bricks : First is the build of the little outpost, a very small building which could have been a bit bigger. It is just big enough to place a small knight in it, a bit bigger so you can hide the crossbow behind it would have been better. The prisoner carriage is a strong, great looking vehicle on a good scale. It hides a surprising (in my opinion unrealistic and unnecessary) shooting device but it stays a nice carriage. The built is all with small parts so pleasant and good for every age. I like the way how the horse is attached to the cart, a new possibility instead of the old fashioned use of the horse hitching part.

Parts 4 bricks : Nothing really spectacular but all very good and useful parts with the new horse, 3 nice mini figures with a sufficient amount of weapons. The parts used for the outpost and carriage are useful in every way. We also have a well filled treasure chest, a whip and a frog.

Playability 5 bricks : All a kid needs for hours of fun with this single set. Two opposite factions with a carriage, a small building and a big crossbow. So 5 bricks well deserved and also a set to be added to other Castle sets.

Value 4 bricks : The price is reasonable but it can always be better. With a bigger outpost or an extra Dragon Knight it would have been 5 bricks or a discount to € 15,00. We stay human so will always find something to complain about the price.

author: PizzaBrick
title: Should of got more castle sets!
review:
Out of all of the 2013 castle sets this is the only one I have (Regrets), I think it

is an excellent set and is worth the money

 

Building Experience!

This set is surprisingly fun to build, the cart and outpost is fun with the angles on them and the cart is satisfying at the end of the build

 

Parts!

As a lover of the fantasy era of sets the parts are really useful, I’m building my own medieval kingdom and these are some of the only knight parts I have, along with the LEGO movie Castle set. The shield, helmet and uniforms are useful and the treasure is a nice addition.

 

Overall a really Fun, Happy set. It’s more a carriage ambush then gold getaway but the name explains the gold, the missile play feature is fun to try to hit a moving cart!
